I guess I’m just taking a moment to marvel at the determination of the people around me. It’s really quite something. Everyone has such clear, urgent ideas of where and when and how I should be. It’s almost dazzling to be at the center _ of so many intersecting agendas.
You must be very tired. KATE stares down at the EMPTY TROPHY CASE on Jack’s desk.
I mean, look at this thing. Just sitting here, waiting... (turning to Jack) What if it just stays empty? What if there’s nothing to ever put in there?
It’s late. We’re both tense. (gently) If you don’t want to go to bed it’s fine by me. No.
No, I’m-going up... (she starts away) +-.These little victories can be so exhausting. JACK stands there, mouth open, as she leaves. cut TO: INT. DOUG’S APARTMENT -- NIGHT A clock reads 3:45.
striding across the good reason -- it’s DOUG slouched before the TV -- KATE AND BRIAN skating in competition, ice, and if this looks familiar there’s the broadcast of their Calgary disaster.

Here comes the triple toe loop... KATE into BRIAN’s arms -- he’s liftng -- too fast --' he falters -- too late -- she’s launched -- into the air -- spinning -- around and around but -- trouble -- she’s off
203 balance -- coming down -- BRIAN watching in horror -- KAT falling to the ice as the MUSIC crashes its final CRESCEN
Oh dear... DOUG sits there, watching, wondering, as the commentary CONTINUES (QVER) and we -- DISSOLVE To: EXT. A MOUNTAIN CHATEAU -- DAY. A sprawling estate. Snow-capped Alps. SUPERIMPOSE:
KATE, DOUG, ANTON and JACK standing there, looking around as SEVERAL MAIDS and VALETS bring in their luggage. cuT TO:
VARIOUS QUICK SHOTS -- establishing the chaos, magnitude and excitement of the Winter Olympics in full swing: SKIE

head_text.subj: JUMPING...A LUGE FLYING DOWN THE TRACK...BIATHLETES RACIN

text: A gorgeous, new facility. SKATERS, COACHES, JUDGES and REPORTERS scattered around the ice, watching DOUG and KAT and HALF A DOZEN INTERNATIONAL PAIRS practice on the ice
KATE and DOUG out practicing with THREE OTHER PAIRS. KATE comes out of a turn nearly crashing into -- LORIE PAULSEN skating in with BRIAN out of nowhere.
We missed you at the opening ceremonies.
(to Kate) Trouble in paradise?
(wheeling on Lorie) Get the fuck away from my partner.  Heads turn. LORIE stiffens. BRIAN pulls her away.
(shocked) You didn’t have to do that.

Better late than never. A beat. KATE unsure what this means, about to ask, when something draws her attention off the ice. THEY BOTH TURN IN THE RUNWAY -- TWO YQUNG ASIAN SKATERS moving with a la ENTOURAGE OF HANDLERS and SECURITY PEOPLE toward the ice.
Izuto and Tenaki... IZUTO AND TENAKI laughing with their COACHES, real loose.
God, they look so young.
They’1l age a little when they see our slingshot triple.
We’re not doing it. DOUG turns back. This is news. The BUZZER SOUNDS. . DouG What do you mean?
I’m taking it off the progran. It’s too dangerous. Without another word, she skates away. CUT To:
A baronial table looks empty with just KATE, DOUG, ANTON and JACK spread around it. RAISED VOICES ECHO through the chateau’s gothic hallways -- A heated argument in progres
-- I’d just like to know why I busted my nuts for five weeks on a move she never had any intention of trying!
-- Douglas --
-- Will you please remind him the number of possible point reductions we're talking about here!
Oh bullshit! -- You don’t want to win! You just want to get through this without dusting your precious ass!
Whe the hell do you think you’re talking to?
Stuff it, Jack! This is between us! JACK sits there, stunned. DOUG turns back to KATE.
Bronze, silver, honorable goddamned mention -- It doesn’t really make a aifference to you at all, does it? You’re a rich girl -- So what if you come up a little short, right?
. Douglas -- stop! Silence. DOUG stands, stares at her across the table.
Just so you know: I’m working without anet here. Losing gracefully does shit for me! KATE, staggered, sits back, says nothing.
It’s up to her. She doesn’t want to do it -- it’s out! DOUG turns to ANTON. No help here. DOUG walks.
Sun glistening on the mountains. OLYMPIC MUSIC SWELLS and
cur To:
Skates being laced up, covers being pulled tight: PURPLE
106 FINALLY TO -- BLACK SKATES -- DOUG lacing up in the MEN’S LOCKER ROOM.
THE LADIE’S LOCKER ROOM Buzzing with tension. KATE doing everything she can not to look over at LORIE.
A packed house. SYNTHESIZED POP-ROCK BLARING. The CROWD watching HASTINGS AND MULGREW conclude their short progra
waiting to go on next. DOUG, in familar, pre-skate pallor fingers his tunic.
(noting his shirt) You forgot a button.
No, I want it like that. In the BG, HASTINGS AND MULGREW come off the ice.
It looks like shit.
Kate, please...lighten up.
(instigating) It’s meant to be buttoned.
It pulls at my neck.
Then you should’ve mentioned it three weeks ago. A FRENCH OLYMPIC OFFICIAL leans in, ushering them forward
Prenez la piste... THE CROWD REACTS to the previous scores as KATE and DOUG pull off skate-guards, start down the runway and --
107 SKATE CAM CLOSE-UP -- as they take several wide warm-up. turns. Two big smiles, frozen in place,. belie whispered. barbs through clenched teeth that only WE CAN HEAR:
I’m asking you for the last time. (Doug ignores her) Button the goddamned button.
Get over it.
You are an immature asshole of the lowest order. That’s it. DOUG snaps. His grip tightening at her waist.

(still smiling) If it was forty below and that button meant the difference between a long, satisfying life and a horrible death by hypothermia, I still wouldn’t give you the fucking satisfaction. THE BUZZER GOES OFF =~ it’s showtime. . CUT To:

MUSIC PLAYING as KATE and DOUG move through the final pas _of ‘their short program -- skating well but mechanically anger, the distance between’ them is visible -- into a do split Lutz twist lift -- KATE in the air -- and down and hovering over her at center ice as the MUSIC CRASHES IT’S FINISH. They stand, bowing stiffly to the APPLAUSE, befor skating for the runway. PEGGY AND DICK -- the two NETWORK ANNOUNCERS, break in.
Technically superior program, Peggy, but did you feel, as I did, that there was something missing?

Absolutely, Dick. They delivered all the short program required moves but it seemed cold -- more like we were watching two individual athletes than a fluid pair. They just didn’t look like they were having fun out there.
And here come the scores --
just off the runway. DOROTHY HAMILL holds a microphone to KATE and DOUG as they tensely watch the scores above, we see them on the network GRAPHIC.

L‘ nombre des points technicale: 5.9, 5.8, 5.8, 5.7, 5.9, 5.8, 5.7, 5.8. (a beat} L’nombre des points artistique: 5.6, 5.7, 5.8, 5.6, 5.7, 5.6, 5.6, 5.7. Stiff smiles harden. DOROTHY leans in with the mike.

Kate, it looked like you two were having trouble connecting out there. (she waits, Kate is silent) Did you feel like your energy might have been a little down? An awkward moment. KATE can’t find her tongue.

(still probing Kate) Was the altitude a problem? KATE hesitates, too tight to talk. DOUG jumps in -- pous / The ice was lousy. We were off our game. Well be back tomorrow -- Okay? DOROTHY, thrown, stares over as DOUG pulls KATE OUT OF FR cut To:
A -PROKOFIEV CLASSIC BOOMING through the house. IZUTO AND TENAKI skating -- a little clinical, but looking real goo two young phenoms tearing through their program.
KATE, in street clothes, stands there lifelessly. ANTON, furious, stares over as DOUG, carrying his skate bag, loo very sour, strides toward then.
(disgusted) What a long way to be coming for such garbage skating.  109
(in no mood) Look, I’1l see you later. I. gotta walk it off.
No. Absolutely no. We go back. DouG I said, I’m going for a walk. ANTON steps forward, just about to really get into it whe

Let him go! (they turn) If he’s smart, he’ll walk all the way back to Minnesota and forget this ever happened! (she looks wild) He didn’t screw up out there. He came to skate ~- just like he always does -- to skate and win and try to make something out of all this crap. (tears welling) It’s my fault. Me. I’m the one who screwed it up.
(moving for her) Katya, please...

Stop! Don’t-you dare try and baby me. I’m the one whd’s. responsible and I deserve to feel exactly as lousy as I do right now! (staring at Doug) I’m sorry. I’m very, very sorry. And now, before she starts to sob, she turns -- running as fast as she can away down the hall. ANTON following --

Katya! -- Katya, wait! DOUG, staggered, stands there, watching them disappear, digesting what’s just occured. Finally, he takes a deep breath, muscles his skate bag over his shoulder, turns, and starts walking in the opposite direction --
DOUG wandering alone through the crowd.  119
The U.S. HOCKEY TEAM scrimmaging in this otherwise empty facility. DOUG lingering in the shadows, watching.
Can I help you? DOUG turns. AN ASSISTANT COACH stands there.
If you’re not part of the program, I’m.gonna have to ask you to leave. DOUG nods. Walks off. CUT To:
KATE stands alone, staring out at the mountains. ANTON comes out through the doors. Crosses to her. Puts a coat over her shoulders. They stand there.

(almost to herself) We come around that far turn and we're picking up speed and we’re going so fast and I keep telling myself I should be concentrating on my free leg and my grip, but all I can think about is how much I don’t trust him. And then, the moment I’m in the air, all I can think about is how much I don’t trust myself. ’ ANTON (gently) Katya, Slingshot is out. Is done. We will skate New Orleans program . and’ it will be wonderful. . KATE says nothing. They stare out into the distance.
I have decided these are the most beautiful mountains I have ever seen.
I’m retiring after tomorrow. For real.
Is not unexpected news.  liz
He'll find another partner. He’s good enough.
He will find no one like you. No matter what he does. KATE ponders this. A long pause.
Think he’1ll be back tonight?
He‘ll make it. (she glances over, ‘ Anton smiles) I trust hin. KATE nods. Pulls the coat more tightly around her.
DOUG, alone, wolfs down the last of his dinner. Alone in the crowd. He looks up to see A COUPLE at the next table, locked in a passionate kiss. He drains his beer. Stands.
DOUG enters. He drops his bag. The house is dark, quiet. He listens. And then wearily starts to climb the stairs.
INT. KATE’S CHATEAU BEDROOM -- NIGHT KATE, her Chicago Blackhawks jersey bundled around her, sitting awake in bed.

‘INT. ‘DOUG’S CHATEAU BEDROOM -- NIGHT DOUG can’t sleep either. In a chair, staring out the wind DISSOLVE To: DOUG’S BEDROOM -- MORNING SUDDEN SUNLIGHT as ANTON pulls the curtains. DOUG asleep in the chair, rustles, eyes opening slowly: :
«.-Oh man...what time is it?
‘Noon. TI let you sleep.  DouG (springing up) Noon? -- Jesus, Anton, they’re starting at one!
You missed the draw. We skate last. We have time.
Where’s Kate? -- How is she?
She’s fine. She and Jack left early. (all business) You wash up. We go together.
Standing room only crowd. Tension you can taste. THE VOICES OF PEGGY AND DICK break over the picture:

Here they are, the final four pairs are warming up.* ON THE ICE -- LORIE-BRIAN, TURGEYEV-GREKA, IZUTO-TENAKI. PEGGY (OVER) . We've seen some lovely skating so far this afternoon, but I think it’s pretty safe to say that our medalists are all out on the ice right now. FINALLY TO -- KATE AND DOUG skating through a lift sectio practicing silently. Skating on eggshells.
Yes, this is the cream. And in the next half hour, we’ll be watching ‘one of these pairs rise to the top. THE BUZZER SOUNDS -- THE SKATERS wrap up the practice.
SHOSTAKOVITCH booming. TURGEYEV AND GREKA on the ice --
...a little sloppy on that arabesque ...and here comes the double Axel... GREKA leaves the ice -- TURGEYEV lifting her -- she arche TURGEYEV’s arms falters just slightly and --
113 ” CUT TO:

text: DOUG breathing. KATE stretching. Nobody talking, as the SHOSTAKOVITCH crescendoes to a CLOSE. THE CROWD APPLAUDIN
FIFTEEN TV MONITORS going -- all various angles of BRIAN AND LORIE skating to “ANYTHING GOES" AS A TV CREW OF EIGH PEOPLE, crammed into this tight. space, work and CHATTER
(calling shots) Okay...Camera three -- Get a little wider, Eddie -- Wider! (continuing as--) ON THE MONITORS -- BRIAN AND LORIE skate some fancy toe-w side-by-side, and into a death spiral --
Beautiful extension, but they’re not going for the forward inside here. The difficulty factor on this is low.
It’s a safe program, but they’re executing very nicely... cUuT TO:

OLYMPIC OFFICIALS and TV CREWS choking the sightlines as BRIAN and -LORIE move through the end of their program. RICK TUTTLE nervous, totally focused on his skaters. ANTON, KATE and DOUG at the rear of the runway peering ou KATE and ANTON watching the skating as "ANYTHING GOES* blares to its CONCLUSION and THE CROWD ROARS its approval
BRIAN and LORIE standing with TUTTLE and DOROTHY HAMILL in the INTERVIEW AREA as their scores flash on the screen
L’nombre de points technical: 5.8, 5.7, 5.8, 5.7, 5.7, 5.8, 5.7, 5.8. (beat) L’nombre de points artistique: 5.9, 5.9, 5.8, 5.9, 6.0, 5.8, 5.9, 5.8.
Big smiles. TUTTLE hugs his skaters.
Great scores! Neuman and Paulsen, looking well positioned for a medal.
Yes Peggy, but I’m not sure it will be gold. They might’ve played it just a little safe. Still to skate are Izuto and Tenaki and Kate Moseley and Doug Dorsey.
KATE and DOUG stand quietly with ANTON as THE OPENING NOTES OF "PEER GYNT" begin in the BG..

(hypnotically) A flame...the fire, the purity of flame is burning away imperfection. All mistakes. All difficulty. Ail effort. Everything is burned away except ice and skates. Everything falls away except perfection. (he pauses) . I go now. I find a seat. I watch the famous Japanese. Come... (he pulls them into his embrace) You are my champions. I am proud. (he pulls back) Enjoy. -KATE and DOUG watch as ANTON walks off through the runwa
IZUTO and TENAKI captured by the TV CAMERAS. Skating grea a double AXEL throw, she lands perfectly --
-- Lovely! -- and here’s the layback ».ea little clinical but right on the money... eo CUT TO:

KATE AND DOUG stretching beside the NETWORK INTERVIEW ARE In the BG, IZUTO and TENAKI spin at CENTER ICE, as the MU CRASHES TO A CLOSE. THE CROWD ROARS its approval. KATE lo up to see DOUG staring at her --  115
You okay? KATE nods tightly.
You?

I guess. They hesitate. A silent moment. Neither of them quite abl to find the words. As suddenly -- IZUTO AND TENAKI -~ five yards away -- come sweeping off ice, into the arms of their ENTOURAGE. Hugs and kisses an LOTS OF JAPANESE CONGRATULATIONS and NETWORK PRODUCTION P trying to get the couple over to DOROTHY HAMILL in the INTERVIEW BOOTH. And judging by the activity and reaction this event is over. KATE frozen, watching all this. She turns to find -- DOUG still staring at her, the rest of the world lost for
I can’t stand this anymore. KATE . Doug, we have to skate...

This won’t wait four and half minutes. (in a rush) Kate, look, maybe I’m a jerk. Maybe I wasn’t ready. Maybe I was afraid. I don’t know. I just have this terrible feeling that after today I’m not gonna see you again and... I don’t care about the skating, I just.don/t.want it to end for us. KATE stares. Both of them terrified by what’s just been s
Doug...no...we’re not right for each other -- We’re not.
Yes we are! I’m right for you. I know it. I fee) it.
(weakly) It would never work.  116
It already has! -- We’ve just been so goddamned wrapped up in the rest of this stuff that we couldn’t see it.
It’s too complicated.

There’s nothing complicated about it. (he steps closer) Kate, I never met anybody like you before. It took me a long time to get used to it but now... (he smiles) Who else is gonna put up with your shit? KATE, reeling, as THE CROWD AROUND THEM COMES ALIVE -- TH

text: KATE AND DOUG stand there -- suddenly aware of the situat
(turning back) We’re doing the triple.
What?
You heard me. ” pous No. No way. A hovering OLYMPIC OFFICIAL leans in --
You may take the ice please.
(ignoring this) I thought you wanted to win. I know you do. I’m the one who put us in this hole, and I say it’s the triple.
Kate, look, forget about it. We’re doing the double, I’m not having you fall.
A FRENCH OFFICIAL steps forward, pushing them toward the
S’il vous plais -- Allez y...
(turning on him) Lay off a minute, willya! The OFFICIAL steps back, shocked. OTHERS in the runway begin to take notice as KATE starts for the ice --
-- Look at me! (grabbing her back) The last thing I want to do is start running your life.
So we’re agreed. Triple.
No! -- It’s not worth it. You don’t have to do this for me.
(with a smile) I’ve fallen before. It’s not the end of the world --
DouG -- Kate, listen, please -- ANOTHER FRENCH OFFICIAL rushes into the fray.
-- Vous avez trente seconds -- Seconds -- pour monter ‘sur la glace!
(to Official #3) -- Shut the hell up for a minute! It’s getting chaotic -- KATE looks around, FACES everywhe
Kate --
-- Patineurs! S’il vous plais! Before DOUG can say another word, KATE takes his hand, pulling him down the runway, kicking off her skate guards
Fifteen seconds! TWO OLYMPIC OFFICIALS drop to their knees, whipping off DOUG’s guards as he staggers forward in KATE’s grip and -
KATE AND DOUG instinctively manufacturing smiles as they glide toward their opening position, whispering as they g
Double.
Triple. They stop at CENTER ICE. Stiffly srike their opening pose
Double. THE CROWD GOES QUIET. DOUG and KATE, side-by-side.
What difference does it make?

The difference is I love you. She turns -- total, utter, heart-stopping shock. And then she smiles ---a big, confident smile. ” KATE Then how could we possibly miss? " DOUG can’t argue, because THE MUSIC STARTS POUNDING and it sounds familiar, that’s because this is The Song and - THEY’RE OFF and we’ve seen competition skating before, but never nore than thirty seconds, and never, never, anything like this around the ice -- Killian position -- accelerating into a wicked camel spin -- and out, and they look terrific and
Toe work across the ice -- perfect -- power -- intensity focus -- elegance -- and they’re smiling for real -- comp eye-contact -- lost in themselves as --
Wow! What a difference a day makes. This is hot!

DOUG lowers KATE into a death spiral -- her pony-tail jus brushing the ice -- around and around and then, as if she were weightless, he’s lifting -- pulling her to him as if his very life depended on it and --
mouth open, not believing what he’s seeing and --
DOUG easing KATE off her skates -- above him -- a platter lift -- she arches in the air -- DOUG turning and --
DORSEY’S PENALTY BOX -=- MINNESOTA The place is packed. All eyes on the big screen above the bar. Thunderstruck silence -- WALTER moving with the MUSIC, a big, dumb smile on his face and --
MARTIN’S ROOM -- MANSION <- CONNECTICUT MARTIN huddled on his couch, amid popcorn and cookies, watching TV. Grinning from ear to ear.
KATE and DOUG side-by-side mirror movements -~ everything instinctive -- MUSIC BUILDING -- staring at each other -- devouring each other with their eyes and -- cUuT TO:
looking on in amazement and --
standing with LORIE and BRIAN, he can’t help himself, he breaks a smile -- this is something truly special --
a double Lutz washing into a serpentine cross step and -- cuT TO:
in the stands, not yet daring to believe his eyes and --
Cameras sweeping to keep up as KATE and DOUG whip through a cross chasse, rounding the end of the rink and --
_There’s steam coming off the ice!
Here comes the double... cuT To:
KATE and DOUG, rounding the rink -- about to break --

(under her breath) Triple! Triple! -~ and they separate -- picking up speed -- into DOUG’s arms -- and she’s up and exploding into -- SLO-MOTION -- -- KATE in the air -- soaring -- around....and around....and around...and landing like a feather! -- Perfectly into DOUG’s waiting arms and --
blown away. Witnessing history and they know it. CUT To:
Dead silence. The DIRECTOR and EVERYONE ELSE just staring at the monitors.
into it, moving to the beat as the MUSIC CRANKS -- OUT OF THE BRIDGE -~ INTO THE FINAL CHORUS and -- cuT To:

KATE and DOUG on some other plane of existence -- hand in hand -- lost in each other’s eyes -- a moment -- and then she’s rising into a one~hand lasso lift -- and forget abo any more cutaways, this is all KATE and DOUG -- she’s up. they’re moving -- DOUG’s arm like a steel rod, no hesitat

122 and THE MUSIC PEAKS and he pushes and KATE is up -- and turning -- and coming down -- and down -- and at the last possible second, DOUG sweeps in to catch her and it’s all perfect -- the final push toward center ice -- accelerati -- faster -- MUSIC CLIMAXING and finally -- A SIDE-BY-SID BLUR SPIN at center ice -- right in the JUDGE’S FACES -- two crazy tops drilling down and down and they fall into other’s arms as THE MUSIC ENDS and -- - THE CROWD -- on its feet -- THIRTY THOUSAND PEOPLE GOING NUTS and -- JACK screaming and carrying on like a teenage girl and -- TUTTLE, LORIE, and BRIAN <- cheering right along and -- IZUTO AND TENAKI --. shaking their heads and -- THE JUDGES -- hearing the CROWD and -- ANTON -- smiling, exhausted, wiping away tears and -- THE ICE -- littered with flowers, and they’re still comin bouquets raining down from everywhere and --
KATE AND DOUG -~ completely oblivious to everything, all over each other, locked in a passionate, all-consuming, never-let-you-go kiss that just goes on and on and...
except now it’s been enlarged and it’s no longer empty -- TWO GOLD MEDALS side by side and --

A reprise of the opening scene. The two, lovely, innocent SIX-YEAR-OLD CHILDREN we watched skate so touchingly befo Except now they’re not skating, they’re FIGHTING -- argui crying, finger pointing -- a furious clash of wills that grows more heated, AS WE --
